meanings.definition: Not having been repaired or restored
meanings.sent1: The old house had an uncobbled roof that leaked when it rained.
meanings.sent2: The uncobbled road was bumpy and full of potholes.
meanings.sent3: The uncobbled bicycle looked like it had seen better days.
meanings.sent4: Her uncobbled memories of childhood remained untouched by time.
meanings.sent5: The uncobbled vase on the shelf was cracked and chipped.

meanings.definition: Not having a rough or uneven surface
meanings.sent1: The uncobbled floor was smooth and shiny after being polished.
meanings.sent2: She preferred walking on the uncobbled path because it was easier on her feet.
meanings.sent3: The uncobbled stone felt cool to the touch on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent4: His uncobbled voice was soothing and calming to those who listened.
meanings.sent5: The uncobbled fabric was soft and gentle against her skin.
